private_information: Expert in STRIPS/ADL-style action modeling and grounded simulation semantics
Will not emit PDDL directly; produces an implementation-agnostic domain sketch
Keeps identifiers consistent with the use-case (lowercase action names, predicate names as given)
domain_modeler.goal: Extract a clean, unambiguous action schema set, predicate inventory, and object universe from the public use-case to support downstream problem engineering and orchestration.

private_information: Constructs problem instances faithfully from the provided statements without inventing facts
Carries over the human-provided plan for Scenario A verbatim for auditing
scenario_engineer.goal: Produce two problem specifications: Scenario A (with initial state, goals, and the provided plan) and Scenario B (with initial state and goals only).

private_information: Audits temporal/causal consistency via forward simulation of preconditions and effects
Removes bookkeeping shortcuts and prohibits quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or any non-causal scoring artifacts
If issues are found, proposes minimally modified corrected plans
auditor.goal: Validate or correct the provided plan for Scenario A against the domain sketch and report issues and fixes, ensuring strict causal soundness without shortcuts.

private_information: Must emit a complete PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem wrapped in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags
Keeps naming consistent with the domain sketch and problem specs; uses standard STRIPS/ADL features supported by Fast Downward; uses typing; avoids functions and metrics
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the domain sketch with Scenario B and the audit insights to produce the final PDDL domain and problem compatible with Fast Downward.

public_information: Domain summary: actions and their conditions/effects are as follows.
paltry(a,b,c) requires hand a, cats b, texture c, vase a b, and next b c; effects add next a c; delete vase a b.
sip(a,b,c) requires hand a, cats b, texture c, next a c, and next b c; effects add vase a b; delete next a c.
clip(a,b,c) requires hand a, sneeze b, texture c, next b c, and next a c; effects add vase a b; delete next a c.
wretched(a,b,c,d) requires sneeze a, texture b, texture c, stupendous d, next a b, collect b d, and collect c d; effects add next a c; delete next a b.
memory(a,b,c) requires cats a, spring b, spring c, and next a b; effects add next a c; delete next a b.
tightfisted(a,b,c) requires hand a, sneeze b, texture c, next b c, and vase a b; effects add next a c; delete vase a b.

Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; hand object_10; hand object_11; hand object_9; next object_0 object_5; next object_10 object_5; next object_11 object_5; next object_3 object_6; next object_4 object_7; next object_9 object_8; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_7; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8.
Scenario A goal: next object_10 object_8, next object_11 object_7, next object_9 object_6.

Scenario A provided plan (ordered): sip object_11 object_0 object_5; sip object_10 object_0 object_5; memory object_0 object_5 object_7; paltry object_11 object_0 object_7; paltry object_10 object_0 object_7; clip object_10 object_4 object_7; wretched object_4 object_7 object_8 object_2; clip object_9 object_4 object_8; tightfisted object_10 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_7 object_2; tightfisted object_9 object_4 object_7; sip object_9 object_0 object_7; memory object_0 object_7 object_5; paltry object_9 object_0 object_5; wretched object_3 object_6 object_5 object_1; clip object_9 object_3 object_5; wretched object_3 object_5 object_6 object_1; tightfisted object_9 object_3 object_6.

Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_3; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_10; hand object_11; hand object_12; next object_0 object_6; next object_1 object_8; next object_10 object_9; next object_11 object_6; next object_12 object_6; next object_4 object_7; next object_5 object_8; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_8; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Scenario B goal: next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_8.

model.system_prompt: You are a planning domain analyst. From the provided public information, extract the object universe, predicates, and action schemas with parameters, preconditions, add effects, and delete effects. Produce a neutral JSON domain_sketch with fields: objects, predicates, actions (name, parameters, preconditions, add_effects, del_effects). Do not emit PDDL.
model.prompt: Your name is domain_modeler. Use the public domain summary and scenarios to derive a clean action model. Preserve the exact identifier spellings (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted; cats, hand, sneeze, spring, stupendous, texture, collect, next, vase). Avoid inventing predicates or objects. Output only the JSON domain_sketch artifact.

scenario_A.system_prompt: You are a problem engineer. Build a structured specification for Scenario A including: name, objects, init facts, goal facts, and the provided human plan as an ordered list of grounded actions. Do not emit PDDL.
scenario_A.prompt: Your name is scenario_engineer. Extract Scenario A initial facts, goals, and the given plan from the public information and package them as scenario_A. Do not add or remove facts; keep actions grounded exactly as written.

scenario_B.system_prompt: You are a problem engineer. Build a structured specification for Scenario B including: name, objects, init facts, and goal facts. Do not emit PDDL.
scenario_B.prompt: Your name is scenario_engineer. Extract Scenario B initial facts and goals from the public information and package them as scenario_B. Do not add or remove facts.

audit.system_prompt: You are a temporal and causal plan auditor. Using the domain_sketch and scenario_A, simulate the plan step-by-step, checking preconditions and applying effects. Report whether the plan is valid, the first failing step if any, the reasons, and provide a minimally revised corrected plan if possible. Remove bookkeeping shortcuts and reject any non-causal artifacts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. Validate the provided Scenario A plan against the domain sketch. Provide an audit_report with fields: valid (bool), first_failure_index (or null), reasons (list), corrected_plan (list if changes are proposed), and final_state_summary.

compile_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator for automated planning. Integrate the domain_sketch and scenario_B, using insights from the audit_report to ensure consistency. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem compatible with the Fast Downward solver. Use STRIPS style with typing and standard ADL features supported by Fast Downward, avoid functions and metrics. Enclose the domain inside <domain></domain> and the problem inside <problem></problem>.
compile_pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. Compile the final PDDL domain and a single problem for Scenario B. Keep predicate and object names consistent with the inputs, use lowercase identifiers for actions and predicates, and ensure the problem has the Scenario B init and goal. Output only the tagged PDDL artifacts.
